channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4076] LT: B2B Billing and delivery address should not be editable
item.description:
For B2B customers of the Lithuania roll out it should not be possible to edit the billing address and edit/add delivery addresses.

Please remove the edit icons and gray out the form fields on the following pages.

OPTION 1

Remove edit icons on:

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/address --> for billing and delivery address
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/review

Gray out form fields on:

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/edit-address/b2bbilling/...
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/edit-address/b2bshipping/...
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/address?editmode=true&addressid=...

Remove "Save Button" on

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/edit-address/b2bbilling/...
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/edit-address/b2bshipping/...

Remove "Delete Address" on

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/edit-address/b2bshipping/...

Remove add new address button on:

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/addresses
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/address

B2C customers should be able to add/edit billing and deliver address.

OPTION 2

Remove edit icons on:

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/addresses
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/address --> for billing and delivery address
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/review

Remove add new address button on:

  • https://www.distrelec.ch/my-account/addresses
  • https://www.distrelec.ch/checkout/address
item.summary: LT: B2B Billing and delivery address should not be editable

comments.comment:
Hi Nando,
Could you please review?
Review done. Added another option. Option 2 is less effort. Please define how to proceed.
Decision by Florian and Laurent: Option 2 (plus redirect if url is opened directly.)
Done : I have removed the icons and I have added a check in AccountPageController and DistCheckoutAddressController if a customer from ELFA B2B try to add, edit or remove an address.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4067] DIBS payment: Review page design - character set plus size of data selection
item.description:
FE issues from ticket: DISTRELEC-4067

Review page design - character set plus size of data selection
item.summary: DIBS payment: Review page design - character set plus size of data selection

comments.comment:
Hi Dominic,

We do not have so much customers in Lithuania as far as I know. You are able to use UTF-8 in your pageset but not included in DIBS MAC calculation. Will it fit your requirements?

st regards,

Jakob Lindahl

-----------------------------------

hi rené

anbei sein vorschlag zum utf-8. passt für mich, aber sagt dir das was mit dem MAC calculation? machst du das nach wie vor ohne utf-8?

Dominic Modalek
Frontend Engineer."

-----------------------------------

Hallo Dominic

Ja das machen wir und darauf können wir auch nicht Verzichten.
Sonst könnten die Parameter die wir an DIPS schicken manipuliert werden.

Gruss René

Die Templates sind nun UTF-8 und die Zeichen werden korrekt dargestellt, siehe Screenshot.

Der Screenshot mit den zu engen Dropdowns, wo kommt der her? Eventuell noch "Set in Service" anklicken im Dibs Manager?

We can use ISO8859-1 when the characters are converted to html-entities.

Use the following tool to convert the text:

http://unicode.online-toolz.com/tools/unicode-html-entities-convertor.php

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4049] Webtrekk e-Commerce Parameter-values Confirmation-Page
item.description:
Test-order conducted on test.distrelec.lt (compared attached screenshot respectively source-file of the confirmation page)

-> Current:

wt.customEcommerceParameter =

{ 10 : '112.09', 8 : '17.00', 7 : '0.00', 6 : '0.00', 5 : '2128.51' 4 : '13680496;17450007;15514579' }

;

-> Required:

wt.customEcommerceParameter =

{ 10 : '112.09', 8 : '17.00', 7 : '0.00', 6 : '437,16', 5 : '2518,86' 4 : '13680496;17450007;15514579' }

;

To note: Missing tax-value (cb6 -> 437,16) and incorrect total-value-ordered-products (cb5 -> 2518,86)

Please verify and refactor accordingly. To note: The same two E-Commerce parameters seem to also show some inconsistency on .ch, .it and .at.

Thx Mark

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4033] LT shop - wrong article code in mail sent to customer about quotation request.
item.description:
See attached pdf.
Wrong article code is picked up.
item.summary: LT shop - wrong article code in mail sent to customer about quotation request.

comments.comment:
Jean,
which article did you request the quotation for?

Got it now:
instead of the new sap item number (8 digits), the elfa number (7 digits) should be transmitted.

Done.

I have changed the email-quoteProductPriceBody.vm file to use the codeErpRelevant for SAP :

Article Number: #if(${ctx.movex})${ctx.product.name}#else${ctx.product.codeErpRelevant}#end <br/>

I have also create the new folder for the release v2.0.m7 and add information for the post installation.

@Laurent: The code above is not correct! First of all you give the product name instead of the product code in case of Movex. Second the attribute codeErpRelevant is exactly doing what you need, it delivers the code based on the ERP related to the current web shop. So just have to use this attribute. There is not further logic needed.
So please come by on Monday. I can show you how you can fix that.

attachment.name: ELFA - LT - price and quantity request - wrong article code.pdf
attachment.author: jlebec

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3976] LT - Products are not buyable
item.description:
Try to add the item 1033356 to basket.
An error message "it is not possible to buy this product" appears.

comments.comment:
Also reported in duplucate DISTRELEC-3978
Windows 7 Professional, Service Pack 1
IE 11.0.9600.17041
http://test.distrelec.lt/lt/Komponentai/Aktyvieji-komponentai/Analogin%C4%97s-grandin%C4%97s/c/cat-L2-3D_525338?filter_Price=0+-+1522&sort=ProductNumberMovex:desc
Status logged out, go to mentioned url, add first item in list to cart, an error message appears and article is not added to cart. (img_33-35_pzu_lt)

Also reported in duplicate DISTRELEC-4016

Windows 7 Professional, Service Pack 1
IE 11.0.9600.17041
http://test.distrelec.lt/lt/TFT-display-3-2%22-320-x-240-Pixel-Electronic-Assembly-EA-EDIPTFT32-A/p/11026969
Log in as customer 1, import "File Upload A", add article to cart returns an error. (img_58/59_pzu_lt)

The sales status information is not the correct one. We have copy them once from CH just to have some information for LT.
Now we have to delete them and import the correct one and do a new export for FF. Than everything should work.

So the wrong sales status are gone. Now we have to start a FF export for LT, but this is not working at the moment. So you will still find the products, that are not buyable.
But we have an other problem, all this products should get a punchout filter in PIM for LT. Otherwise you can access the product detail page, but without pricesa dn sales information. This ends also than in an error if you try to add the product to the cart.
What is the progress on the FF export?
never mind, just saw that it is resolved.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3956] Logic of payment/delivery methods
item.description:
Since we know that SAP cannot define the possible shipping and payment method based on the current basket (e.g. Bulky items cannot be delivered by express) we have to provide this logic from web shop site.
We’ll get the necessary information through IF-11 based on the products and we only will offer standard payment and shipment methods per country or customer type (Normal to doors, Express, Pick up/ Invoice, Credit Card etc. -> tbc with business).

comments.comment: Who is specifying the business logic?

Florian will do that. SAP will change the logic, so that we just get 3 delivery modes (NTD, Express, PickUp)
Florian will check if we have to implement additional filter logic on shop site like express is just possible for articles that are on stock, etc.

Discusseion with Evangelos, Florian, Francesco, Husi, Adi:

Concerning Payment Methods:

  • SAP will only return the one invoice method that is valid for the given customer
  • Hence no further logic to select the correct invoice option is needed

Concerning Delivery Methods

Result from Florian is:

  • Pick-Up (Goods available in shop stock can be picked up from store 3 hours after order placement)
  • Economy to door (Order normally leaves Elfa Distrelec within 3 days)
  • Normal to door (Order normally leaves Elfa Distrelec the same day)
  • Express (Contact our Customer Service)
@Evangelos: Please have a look at the defined delivery methods in the last comment. Please ensure that we receive the list as defined. Thanks.
Done
